etymology.description: 小(小) (xiǎo, "small; little") + 皇帝(皇帝) (huángdì, "emperor") = a metaphor for a child treated like an emperor -> spoiled child
etymology.interpretation: The term 小皇帝(小皇帝) (xiǎohuángdì, "spoiled child") describes a child who is overly pampered and indulged by their parents, as an emperor would be by his court. This metaphor reflects the increasing trend of indulged children in modern society.

examples.chinese: 妈妈总会满足他的所有要求(媽媽總會滿足他的所有要求)，因为他就像个小皇帝(因為他就像個小皇帝)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā zǒng huì mǎnzú tā de suǒyǒu yāoqiú, yīnwèi tā jiù xiàng ge xiǎohuángdì.
examples.english: Mom always meets all his demands because he acts like a spoiled child.

examples.chinese: 他的行为总让人哭笑不得(他的行為總讓人哭笑不得)，仿佛小皇帝在发号施令(仿佛小皇帝在發號施令)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de xíngwéi zǒng ràng rén kū xiào bù dé, fǎngfú xiǎohuángdì zài fāhào shīlìng.
examples.english: His behavior always confounds people, as if a spoiled child were giving orders.
